member.name: IDirect3DPixelShader9.GetDevice
member.param: Pointer to the IDirect3DDevice9 interface that is returned.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DPixelShader9.GetFunction
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the shader data.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that contains the shader data. The application needs to allocate enough room for this.

Size of the data, in bytes. To get the buffer size that is needed to retrieve the data, set pData = NULL when calling GetFunction. Then call GetFunction with the returned size, to get the buffer data.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be: D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DPixelShader9
member.summary: Applications use the methods of the IDirect3DPixelShader9 interface to encapsulate the functionality of a pixel shader.
